intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium murorum subsp. subcaesium, commonly known as the mouse ear hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow flowering heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has a taproot system and produces small, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. Its flowers are usually arranged in a single head and are visited by various pollinators.
